result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathryn M Noha

defendant.name: Noha, Kathryn M
defendant.address: N19125 County Road O, Dunbar, WI 54119

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kathryn M Noha appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Kathryn M Noha.  Attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Parties request a plea and sentencing date.  Defendant lives about 4 hours away, and Defense requests a Zoom plea and sentencing hearing.  State objects to Zoom appearance.  Court allows defendant to appear by Zoom at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-09-2022
Received and Filed: Jury Instruction - Negligent Operation of a Vehicle
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Kathryn M Noha in court, by zoom, with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kathryn M Noha appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in for scheduling conference.  State made offer.  Defense requested status conference due to finalizing offer with state.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11.  Defendant to appear by zoom.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Kathryn M Noha in court by video with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn who appears in person.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kathryn M Noha in court, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 10, 2022 - received

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.
Court ordered Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered NO DRIVING after taking medications.

Defendant Kathryn M Noha in Court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Kathryn M Noha in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint, and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Case is adjourned for Preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
